main event: A bright silver object resembling a disc was spotted over Sampson AFB, Geneva, NY on October 7, 1953.
interesting points: The object was described as being bright silver in color and cigar-shaped, moving at a high rate of speed for about 20-25 seconds.
A second witness, a young girl, reported the object appeared much larger than a jet aircraft and had a spinning motion.
The object made a great roar or rushing sound that was heard for several minutes after it disappeared from view.
The object was observed by two different witnesses at different times (1123 and 1143 hours).
Weather conditions at the time included hazy skies with 10-12 mile visibility and winds between 8-21 knots.
witnesses: Capt. J.M. Gillis, USAF and a young girl
